product_description.product_group_and_name: Slag Cement, UNSD CPC 3744, UNSPSC Code 30111601
product_description.product_definition: Slag cement, UNSD CPC 3744 and UNSPSC Code 30111601, is defined as granulated blast-furnace slag that has been ground to cement fineness, with or without additions, and is a hydraulic cement.
product_description.product_applicability: Slag cement is a supplementary cementitious material (SCM) typically used in concretes and mortars to replace a portion of the portland cement in, and augment the performance of, concrete and mortars.
product_description.facility_name: Holcim South Chicago Plant, 2150 East 130th Street, Chicago, IL 60633

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: Production, manufacture, and construction of manufacturing capital goods and infrastructure; Production and manufacture of production equipment, delivery vehicles, and laboratory equipment; Personnel-related activities; Energy and water use related to company management and sales activities.
lca_information.data_collection: Gate-to-gate input/output flow data collected for East Chicago granulation and South Chicago slag cement manufacture for the reference year 2019.
lca_information.allocation_rules: Allocation follows ISO 14044 Clause 4.3.4, NSF PCR, and ISO 21930 section 7.2. 'Mass' was used as the physical parameter for allocating flows.

data_quality_requirements.completeness: All relevant processes considered and modeled.
data_quality_requirements.consistency: Relevant background materials and processes taken from US LCI Database and ecoinvent v 3.5.
data_quality_requirements.reproducibility: Internal reproducibility possible; external reproducibility not possible.
data_quality_requirements.transparency: High level of transparency provided throughout the report.

additional_info.environmental_protection_and_equipment: Holcim manufacturing facilities comply with U.S. environmental protection requirements, monitor and report emissions to air during the manufacturing process.
additional_info.pollution_abatement_equipment: High temperature baghouses, cartridge filters, bin vents, and water sprinklers.
